reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fast-paced action with a great feel!

Gunjitsu reminds me of Soldat, but the various additions to movement just makes it even better. The feel of the movement - the grappeling hook, walljumps and the dash - is fantastic. Add to that a set of robust weapons and a couple of friends (or strangers) and it all adds up to a lot of great fun!
Its easy to learn, quick to pick up, but with a lot to master still. Matches are quick and and fast-paced, and the speed-running mode is also great fun.

Highly recommended!
voteText: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gunjitsu is a 2D arena shooter. Like Soldat, but with rockets and grappling hooks.
The player control is already solid, with plenty of mobility options.
I wasn't able to find anybody online, but the bots were fairly competent.
Weapons are a mixed bag, some feel great (shotgun), others aren't as useful or effective as you'd think (grenades and rocket launcher).
The devs are very active at the forums, so I'm pretty sure they'll improve this game a lot over time.
It's a very good start.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game plays good - agains bots that is, because even though the game is given away for free on a large scale right now, you never find a server to join.

+ good concept
+ fast paced action gameplay
+ good balanced weapons
+ good AI
+ you can destroy the environment

- no online players
- you get easily stuck on uneven surfaces
- levels all look and feel very similar
- game often lags
- you can't access the options menu during a game

Some users mention good music" in their reviews
date: but unfortunately for me there were only sound effects and no ingame music. Either those guys did review a different game or the music was broken for me.\n\nAll in all
recommended: the game looks promising but still needs a lot of work and polishing - and more online players."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

2D arena shooter.
Single player (against bots) and multiplayer (if you can find someone) options. Only few weapons to choose. Nothing really stands out, really generic. Levels look and feel the same. Not enough content, but at least game play is solid. Lot's of bugs, but it's early access.
At this state wouldn't buy.

Pros:
- Grappling hook.

Cons:
- Nobody plays this.
- No controller support.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Its a little, fast paced shooter game with grapling hook mechanics. Didn't find much innovation. The art style is good, the sounds are very simple, I think it could be a lot better with more variation. Also adding a fast paced action music would improve things.

Must be more fun for people who enjoy PVP, not really my thing. According to Steam charts there are less than 10 people people playing :( Nowadays it's hard to launch PVP focused games without a great promise of entertainment and innovation. It's sad because the devs mentioned they have been working on the game for 2 years.

Given current state at $8 price I would not recommended it :(

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a really fun little game. The art style is nice and although it has quite a bit of action, it's still relaxing. Swinging around with grappling hooks and direct-hitting your friends with a rocket launcher has never felt better.

The only downside is that it's multiplayer-only. Saying that, there is an offline mode with bots, but the AI isn't perfected yet. But if you and a friend both buy this game it will provide several hours of fun.

Nice game, nice concept.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EARLY ACCESS REVIEW:
Gunjitsu is a decent enough side-view 2D battle arena. Decent enough being the key words here. In a world where indie games come in job lot, decent is barely enough. Of course, it already has a solid enough mechanic, decent graphic, simple control, a game that you can get into without much problem, but that's it. Since this is an Early Access title that does better than many of its broken brethren, I'm inclined to give it a benefit of a doubt. But the dev better come up with something good to set this apart from the masses.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a fast paced, fun and challenging game to play against little bots or friends in multiplayer! It' s a shooter with dimensions of jumping on rooftops and using a grapling hook to swing to destinations as well. I like it!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Swinging around is a lot of fun, and the game has potential, but it needs a lot of work if it wants to be fun for more than 10 minutes. I wish there was a wider variety when it comes to guns. Having some creative weapons could really up the replay value, and pushing people to fight over those and maybe some useful powerups around the map could make the game more intense.

I really do enjoy that you can destroy the environment. The voxel maps are perfect for that, and allow for some cool tactics. However, as I said before, the game becomes a bit boring after you've played it for a while. I hope a few improvements can keep the game interesting in the future.

Early Access Review

Remember the grappling hook from Worms"? You liked that mechanic? Then go and buy this game!

Gunjitsu makes a lot right. The whole game is built around the grappling hook and that is
date: how a game should be. Take the the mechanic that brings the most fun and add some features that support it. The swinging around works great and is really fun
recommended: once you figured out how to use it best. Generally
hoursPlayed: the movements in this game just work. Swinging
votesHelpful: it all makes you feel like some sort of sci-fi ninja. Awesome!\nThe shooting part is a perfect addition to that. You quickly pick up all the controls you need and can start playing with bots or online with friends. While it's easy to learn the basics
votesTotal: it will take some time to master the controls and perfect your timing. I had not a single frustrating moment in this game
votesFunny: even when I died several times in a row
commentsCount: as it is very fun to watch. Getting shot with a pumpgun in the middle of a jump let's you skid away like ragdoll. Quite amusing.\n\nSo
column17: convince your friends to do so as well (the price is really fair I think) and have some fun!"

Early Access Review

*Early Access Review*

One of the other reviews called this a generic battle arena game and I think that pretty well sums it up.  It isn't a bad game and I would say worth $3-5 if you like the genre and had regular friends to play with.  As is, my opinion is it is a bit overpriced and not many people are playing.  There isn't really a goal and I think that would help it somewhat as nothing really stands out here from the crowd of other similar shooter games.  Adding something like scoring goals on top of the battle or maybe a capture the flag mode might help.   Also needs some different environments as the platforms here are all pretty much the same.  Overall I will give it a recommend if you can pick it up on sale based on how it currently stands even it wasn't developed any more.  As it is still in early access, further improvements could possibly justify a higher price as there is that dreaded word that applies here....it has potential"."

Really fun game. Don't have much time on it, but from the controls, and battling the bots for alittle, it's insanely fun.

8/10 overall. Graphics are 8bit looking, but it's appealing to those who like it. Some bugs, that they do state when you load for the first time, you sometimes don't respawn when you suicide to the bottom of map

Early Access Review\n\nThis is a fun multiplayer game to play with friends and even when playing with bots, it was fun. Controlling of grappling can take quite a while to get use to move efficiently across the map fast. graphically wise it can be more detailed and the variety of weapons are great, killing opponents with rocket and grenade is most satisfying. However there is lack of controller support and local multi-player option which will makeit a great family & friends game in a living room.

Early Access Review

It's a multiplayer game being given away for free at the moment of the review but I can't find anyone playing online. There's no Campaign mode or anything, sure you can play with bots but who buys a multiplayer game to play vs bots?

The game itself can be fun, there is a lot of mobility based gameplay with lots of jumping and throwing hooks and blasting your opponents with weapons but if nobody plays it none of that matters so I can't really recommend it unless that changes in the future, which if the current situation is any clue, it is doubtful that will happen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Full Disclosure: I received the game from OrlyGift for the purpose of reviewing.

TL;DR - This isn't for me, but it might be for you.
I've tried giving this game a bit of a try, but it's very difficult without multiplayer.  I've played against the bots which were a bit easy for training dummies.

The graphics are still a bit rough and the animations could use a fix here and there.  An example of this is the air dash" mechanic using the on-ground sprint animation.  Running in the sky made it seem like a bugged game element more than anything else.

It has the feel of a game made for a flash games site
date: but juiced up a bit.  If you like those games
recommended: this is a great title.  If you don't
hoursPlayed: it might be best to avoid it.\n\nIt's hard for me to say I don't recommend this game; it's fine for what it is... but it's not for me."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Full Disclosure: I received the game from OrlyGift for the purpose of reviewing.

TL;DR - This isn't for me, but it might be for you.
I've tried giving this game a bit of a try, but it's very difficult without multiplayer.  I've played against the bots which were a bit easy for training dummies.

The graphics are still a bit rough and the animations could use a fix here and there.  An example of this is the air dash" mechanic using the on-ground sprint animation.  Running in the sky made it seem like a bugged game element more than anything else.

It has the feel of a game made for a flash games site
date: but juiced up a bit.  If you like those games
recommended: this is a great title.  If you don't
hoursPlayed: it might be best to avoid it.\n\nIt's hard for me to say I don't recommend this game; it's fine for what it is... but it's not for me."

Early Access Review\n\nA fun, fast-paced 2D action game.

Early Access Review\n\nSo, I gave this game a whirl and what can I say.  It's an intersting take on the 2D battle arena.  It's got a mixture of that Smash... uhm Uncles? game and Speed Runners.  You get  weapons and a grappling hook.  It's nothing inovative yet it is a fun one to play.  Trying to play the training mission was a bit frustrating when my system exceeds the requirements and it's being choppy.   Overall, Gunjitsu is a fun battle arena game.  This is the type of game that needs a 4-pack option if you want to take on your friends.  Happy slaying.

Early Access Review

While this game is enjoyable it has some big major drawbacks for me. These drawbacks include the following:
1) Hardly anyone (if anyone at all) is ever on multiplayer.
2) I often find myself having a hard time walking over uneven terrain.
3) Considering the lower graphic quality of the game, it is very laggy. The game could be optimized.

I do want to say that I really enjoy grappling. I like the fact that you can shoot while grappling. I also managed to kill a bot in midair with a grenade while in midair myself, which I thought was pretty sweet. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone personally, but if you enjoy these types of games and don't mind the things I mentioned then I wouldn't discourage you from playing it.

Early Access Review

The game needs a lot more content if it wants to be a good battle arena game. The mechanics are actually pretty good ideas and give a lot of options for fighting.

All character look the same so we need different characters or a way to customize them to make them our own. More power-ups are necessary to increace the fun and for sure more weapon.

I would suggest more unconvetional weapons... shotguns, sniper rifles, machine guns are nice but why not try and do something different? What about melee?

Not to mention the bugs, I even had one where it crashed my graphics driver!!

I recommend because even with all this the game is fun and I hope more content is coming.

Early Access Review

I think this game is pretty fun and reminds me of teeworlds, but unfortunately it is not as good... yet.
I haven't played much and have only played against bots so far, but in that short time of fun there where a few things that hit me except for all the rockets.

1) I felt the movement to be not as responsive as I would like it to be.
2) Weapons seemed a bit unbalanced.
3) Also at some points I would see a massive frame drop for no real apparent reason, as graphics aren't that amazing and my PC really isn't that old.

The above mentioned are mainly my opinion and wouldn't call them game breaking.
As far as recommending the game goes, I would not say that it is a worthy purchase at this point, as I cannot call it complete from my point of view. If you wish to help out and give your feedback to the devs and see the game develop then by all means go ahead.

PS. Gunjitsu is not bad enough to give a thumbs down though :P

Early Access Review

It's good, but it really has the potential to be better, unfotunately either due to a low playerbase or a nonworking netcode, I haven't been able to start a match online, so I only had the opportunity to play vs bots. I really like the idea, the movement is really fun, the mid air dash is kind of weird because it changes your current momentum, but the game is fun, the weapons are kind of unbalanced, the maps are designed in a fun way, but you kind of get stuck in holes and you have to suicide, so this game really needs some polish.

At the current price of 8 euros, I don't think the game is up to snuff, because even tho it is fun it's kind of overshadowed by some other popular arena games at the moment, and since the game is planned to be even pricier at launch, I don't think it's gonna sell very well, which is not gonna bring more players, which brings us to an infinite loop since people won't but this game since no one is playing it.

It's good, but it really has the potential to be better, unfotunately either due to a low playerbase or a nonworking netcode, I haven't been able to start a match online, so I only had the opportunity to play vs bots. I really like the idea, the movement is really fun, the mid air dash is kind of weird because it changes your current momentum, but the game is fun, the weapons are kind of unbalanced, the maps are designed in a fun way, but you kind of get stuck in holes and you have to suicide, so this game really needs some polish.

At the current price of 8 euros, I don't think the game is up to snuff, because even tho it is fun it's kind of overshadowed by some other popular arena games at the moment, and since the game is planned to be even pricier at launch, I don't think it's gonna sell very well, which is not gonna bring more players, which brings us to an infinite loop since people won't but this game since no one is playing it.

Early Access Review\n\nIt's always nice to play a game that you thought was going to be complete crap and end up enjoying yourself. There isn't a lot to Gunjitsu, it's just a really solid sidescrolling multiplayer shooter. But it's the few extra little things sprinkled on top that build on the simple core gameplay to make it really enjoyable. Destroyable pixellated enviornments are a splendid touch that sometimes adds an unexpected dimension of fun or strategy to the match. The vertical arena layout makes kills extra satisfying, making blood and corpses tumble downward in copious amounts. While I hesitate to recommend a multiplayer game with a non-existent online playerbase, I found the bots to be surprisingly worthy foes. As amusing as Gunjitsu is, it can only benefit from additional development, so I do hope this one doesn't get abandoned.
